definitions.definition: to take control of an aircraft or other vehicle during a journey, especially using violence:
examples: Two men hijacked a jet travelling to Paris and demanded $125,000.

definitions.definition: to take control of or use something that does not belong to you for your own advantage:
examples: He resents the way his ideas have been hijacked by others in the department.

definitions.definition: an occasion when someone uses force to take control of an aircraft or other vehicle:
examples: The hijack ended with the release of all the plane's passengers unharmed.
